is subfamily of This is a top-level family.

AcrossDimensionacross.prep
cross.v
Affected motionVery broad notion of "Caused Motion" which applies both to internal and external causal sources/forces, and in which the 'cause' can affect the motion in any one of various ways, including enabling, initiating,helping, impeding, or preventing a (potential) mover's motion.

Impediment to motionThis is a general frame that encapsulates both: active impediments of any kind (a subframe called Motion_impediments), and FAILURE TO enable (a subframe called Lack_of_enablement). Scenario: motion is impeded either by some barrier or antagonistic force; or by the failure to aid/enable motion
Impeding downward motionObjects that impede the downward motion of another entity.safety net
net.n

mob.v
MotionThis is the most general Motion frame. Frame description: All or part of an entity (mover) moves with respect to some landmark or background. This general frame encompasses both "motion-in-place" (movement that can occur within a fixed location, e.g. spinning) and translational motion (in which the mover occupies a series of different locations over time -- see Motion_Along_A_Path). This frame could also be used to specify lack of motion (i.e. speed = 0).move.v
motion.n
shift.v
shift.n
movement.n
mobility.n
mobile.a
immovable.a
Motion along a pathA moving entity starts out in one place and ends up in another, having traversed the distance between these placesMotion, Motion_directional, Motion_scenarioslide.v

Motion with respect to an undesirable entityMover moves so as to not be co-located with an undesirable entity.
Motion-affecting actorsAn animate entity acts on a potential mover (an object or other animate entity), negatively affecting that mover's ability to move.
Motion-affecting external factorsThis is a very high level frame. It refers to things/factors/processes/entities/conditions etc. external to a mover or moving entity, that can (either positively or negatively, unspecified) affect the mover's motion (motion here being unspecified as to whether or not it's on a path or goal-directed).obstacle.n

mob.v
MotionThis is the most general Motion frame. Frame description: All or part of an entity (mover) moves with respect to some landmark or background. This general frame encompasses both "motion-in-place" (movement that can occur within a fixed location, e.g. spinning) and translational motion (in which the mover occupies a series of different locations over time -- see Motion_Along_A_Path). This frame could also be used to specify lack of motion (i.e. speed = 0).move.v
